column2: INDIANA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column8: Railroad Warning

column2: 2. Which of the following is true about the Anti-Locking Brake System?
column4: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation.
column8: It prevents skidding.

column2: 3. If you are facing a red light or arrow, you may not enter the intersection until the light facing you turns green and the intersection is clear.
4. This road sign means:
column8: This parking is reserved for persons with disabilities.

column2: 5. This sign tells drivers:
column4: they may not turn right or left during the red light.
column6: turning right on red is forbidden.
column8: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.

column2: 6. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column6: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.
column8: enter one of the blind spots and wait.

column2: 7. When passing another vehicle, before turning back into the right-hand lane drivers should wait until they can see the vehicle they are passing in the rearview mirror.
8. When driving in fog, you should turn on your high beams.
9. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column6: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.
column8: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column8: Stop

column2: 11. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column6: having them checked by a mechanic.
column8: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.

column2: 12. Collisions can happen more often when one vehicle is traveling slower than the flow of traffic.
13. If a vehicle starts to skid on water the driver should quickly apply the brakes.
14. Drivers must yield the right-of-way to a bicyclist just as they would to another vehicle.
15. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.
column6: increase your speed and move to the left.
column8: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column10: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.

column2: 16. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column6: Allow the wheels to keep turning.
column8: Decrease pressure on the brake pedal if your wheels begin to lock.

column2: 17. What does this sign indicate?
column8: Train intersection

column2: 18. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.
column6: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column8: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.

column2: 19. A good rule for drivers to follow is to stay at least two to three seconds behind the vehicle ahead.
20. This road sign means:
column4: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.
column6: Sharp left turns ahead, in both directions.
column8: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.
column10: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column8: You must turn left ahead

column2: 22. An individual’s driving privileges may be suspended under which of the following conditions?
column4: Illegal transportation of alcohol twice in 12 months if ages 21 or older.
column6: Three reckless driving offenses in 12 months.
column8: Drag or street racing.

column2: 23. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column6: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.
column8: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column10: Jump off your car immediately, if it is safe to do so.

column2: 24. This sign means:
column6: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column8: The road will curve to the right.

column2: 25. Your BAC depends on:
column8: how much time passes between drinks.

column2: 26. The octagonal shape is used:
column4: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.
column8: for yeild signs.
column10: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.

column2: 27. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column4: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.
column6: wait until the crossing gates are completely up.
column8: look and listen for trains.

column2: 28. This sign means:
column8: 270 degree turn ahead.

column2: 29. Drivers may pass on a two-lane roadway marked with a single solid yellow line on their side of the center line.
30. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: The bus is about to stop.
column6: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column8: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.
column10: You must pass the school bus.

column2: 31. This warning sign:
column4: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column6: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.
column8: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column10: tells drivers that the minimum safe speed is 45 MPH.

column2: 32. Taillights are not required to be illuminated after dark.
33. Which statement about blind spots is true?
column4: Before changing lanes, you should check mirrors and look over your shoulder toward the rear.
column6: Large trucks have smaller blind spots than most passenger vehicles.
column8: If traffic conditions permit you should cruise in blind spot of the vehicle ahead.

column2: 34. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.
column6: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.
column8: Yes.
column10: Only if the light is green.

column2: 35. What does a flashing red light mean?
column6: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column8: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 36. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column8: The car on your right.

column2: 37. This sign means:
column4: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column8: The divided highway ends ahead.

column2: 38. After a train clears a crossing that has flashing signals, drivers may proceed when there is evidence no trains are approaching the crossing and when the lights have stopped flashing.
39. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column6: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column8: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 40. This symbol is used for:
column8: dangerous intersections.

column2: 41. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
column6: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.
column8: the driver who was going faster before stopping must yield.
column10: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.

column2: 42. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column4: The same thing as a stop sign.
column6: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column8: Warning: hospital ahead.

column2: 43. When approaching a construction site, drivers should:
column4: honk their horn to alert construction workers of their presence.
column6: slow down and adjust their driving manner.
column8: accelerate to get out of the way quickly.

column2: 44. When following a vehicle at night you should dim your headlights.
45. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column4: You should look over your shoulder instead.
column8: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.

column2: 46. The only effective way to reduce your blood alcohol content (BAC) is:
column4: not to drink over a period of time.
column8: fresh air.

column2: 47. This sign indicates:
column8: a no passing zone.

column2: 48. Drivers must give the right or left turn signal when changing lanes.
49. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: make sure you can see the front bumper of the vehicle you passed.
column8: look at your interior rear-view mirror.

column2: 50. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column8: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.
column10: get off the road and check your tires.
